14/*! \file */
15
16#include <config.h>
17
18#include <stdbool.h>
19#include <stddef.h>
20
21#include <isc/mem.h>
22#include <isc/mutex.h>
23#include <isc/once.h>
24#include <isc/util.h>
25
26#include <dns/name.h>
27
28#include <ns/lib.h>
29
30
31/***
32 *** Globals
33 ***/
34
35LIBNS_EXTERNAL_DATA unsigned int ns_pps = 0U;
36
37
38/***
39 *** Private
40 ***/
41
42static isc_once_t init_once = ISC_ONCE_INIT;
43static isc_mem_t *ns_g_mctx = NULL;
44static bool initialize_done = false;
45static isc_mutex_t reflock;
46static unsigned int references = 0;
47
48static void
49initialize(void) {
50 isc_result_t result;
51
52 REQUIRE(initialize_done == false);
53
54 result = isc_mem_create(0, 0, &ns_g_mctx);
55 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
56 return;
57
58 isc_mutex_init(&reflock);
59
60 initialize_done = true;
61 return;
62}
63
64isc_result_t
65ns_lib_init(void) {
66 isc_result_t result;
67
68 /*
69 * Since this routine is expected to be used by a normal application,
70 * it should be better to return an error, instead of an emergency
71 * abort, on any failure.
72 */
73 result = isc_once_do(&init_once, initialize);
74 if (result != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
75 return (result);
76
77 if (!initialize_done)
78 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
79
80 LOCK(&reflock);
81 references++;
82 UNLOCK(&reflock);
83
84 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
85}
86
87void
88ns_lib_shutdown(void) {
89 bool cleanup_ok = false;
90
91 LOCK(&reflock);
92 if (--references == 0)
93 cleanup_ok = true;
94 UNLOCK(&reflock);
95
96 if (!cleanup_ok)
97 return;
98
99 if (ns_g_mctx != NULL)
100 isc_mem_detach(&ns_g_mctx);
101}
102
